intro: Maoutia gracilis, commonly known as the slender maoutia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, clustered leaves. It produces yellowish-green flowers that are often followed by small, round fruits. Maoutia gracilis is typically found in moist, shaded environments within its native habitat.
